articles.author: Swarup Mahato
articles.description:
As a software developer, it's important to have a robust portfolio website that can display our abilities and experiences. To assist other developers, I have designed a portfolio website using Next, Tailwind CSS, and EmailJS. In this article, I will provide a step-by-step guide on the setup process, along with the GitHub link.
Here is the live preview:

STEP 01:
git clone https://github.com/swarupinfotech/developer-portfolio.git
cd developer-portfolio

STEP 02:
npm or yarn.
npm install
# or
yarn


After installation, all packages, Now change all data on utils/data/* according to you. For example:
export const personalData = {
  name: "Swarup Mahato",
  profile: '/profile.png',
  designation: "Software Developer",
  description: "My name is Swarup Mahato. I am a professional and enthusiastiâ€¦
articles.title: Build an awesome developer portfolio website.

articles.author: Crafting Code
articles.description:
From marketers to devs, this suite of clean, no-login tools simplifies your CSV headaches in one tab â€” no spam, no upsells.






  
  
  Why I Built It


Over the years, juggling roles as a developer, marketer, and data wrangler, I noticed one recurring pain point:
Working with CSV files always takes longer than it should.
Cleaning, converting, merging, analyzing â€” the workflows were always fragmented across different sites or scripts. Most existing tools were:
Slow and clunky
Feature-limited
Hidden behind logins or paywalls
So I built CSVToolsOnline.com â€” a complete toolkit that just works, in-browser, and does 95% of what people need from CSVs.
Whether you're a developer, marketer, student, or someone who just dreads opening Excel â€” hereâ€™s what youâ€™ll find:
Convert CSVs Into:



Excel (â€¦
articles.title: I Built a Powerful CSV Toolkit for Everyone Tired of Manual Data Work â€” And Itâ€™s Free

articles.author: Tim Lorent
articles.description:
In the next few weeks, Iâ€™ll explore with you how to choose a developer path: from technical deep dives to people leadership, and everything in between. Whether youâ€™re at a fork in the road or just getting curious, this series is for you. Week 1 will be about exploring (experimentation, choosing a growth theme), Week 2 we'll focus on becoming visible and taking initiative, while the final week is about claiming growth (or moving away) and choosing your own path. Join me on this journey!
Ever feel weird about talking about your own work?
Like if you post a small win, someoneâ€™s going to roll their eyes?

Or that â€œreal devsâ€ donâ€™t need to say theyâ€™re growing, they just are?
Yeah. Been there.
I always thought I would just add to the noise: "There are tons of developers out there who have way moâ€¦
articles.title: Choosing Your Developer Path Series: Visibility Is Key

articles.author: Sharon
articles.description:
WAF which is also known as the Web Application Firewall. Unlike traditional firewalls, WAF operates at the application layer and provides better protection for Web systems based on the HTTP/HTTPS protocol, safeguarding them from hacker attacks.
A Web Application Firewall (WAF) is a security system that sits in front of a web application to inspect, filter, and block malicious traffic. It acts as an intermediary between the internet and your website or web application, examining HTTP requests and responses for potential threats.




Self-Hosted
Web UI
Anti-Exploit

Rate Limiting

articles.title: Free WAFs Compared: Which One Should You Trust?

articles.author: Clariza Look
articles.description:
AWS offers a powerful combination of services that enable developers to build serverless architectures without managing underlying infrastructure. In this guide, we'll explore how to build a robust serverless application using AWS CDK with ECS Fargate and DynamoDB.
The serverless paradigm has transformed how we think about application deployment. By combining ECS Fargate for containerized compute with DynamoDB for managed NoSQL storage, we create an architecture that scales automatically, reduces operational overhead, and optimizes costs. 
The AWS CDK (Cloud Development Kit) makes this entire setup reproducible and maintainable through code.
Github Repository Example to Build Serverless Application with AWS CDK: ECS Fargate & DynamoDB
Our serverless architecture follows a clean, layered apâ€¦
articles.title: Building Serverless Application with AWS CDK: ECS Fargate & DynamoDB

PR reviews has always been time consuming and repetitive! With my co founder we built a tool called Codoki PR Intelligence (live in GitHub) to speed this up. 
There are other tools out there, but we've fine tuned it to be simpler to install and use, focus on the core fixes, and scale with individual dev needs! 
Would love any and all feedback! Check it out on: https://github.com/apps/codoki-pr-intelligence
articles.title: Speed up your PR Reviews!

articles.author: Aviral Srivastava
articles.description:
Monitoring with Amazon CloudWatch


Introduction:
Amazon CloudWatch is a comprehensive monitoring and observability service offered by AWS. It collects and tracks metrics from AWS resources and applications, providing insights into their performance and operational health.  This allows for proactive identification and resolution of issues, optimizing resource utilization, and ensuring application stability.
Prerequisites:
Before using CloudWatch, you'll need an active AWS account.  No special software installation is required; CloudWatch is accessed through the AWS Management Console, AWS CLI, or various SDKs.
Features:
CloudWatch offers a wide array of features, including:
Metrics:  Tracks key performance indicators (KPIs) like CPU utilization, memory usage, network traffic, and more.  Yoâ€¦
articles.title: Monitoring with Amazon CloudWatch

Streamlit â€“ For building the web interface

bash
pip install streamlit google-generativeai pymupdf

articles.title: Simplify Your Study Life with AI Notes Summarizer using Streamlit & Gemini!
